intro: Kyllinga ugogensis, commonly known as the African arrowhead, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. Kyllinga ugogensis is often found in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. It is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
